Name: View Inventory
Brief Description: The system should provide a categorized view of the entire inventory to the Construction Junction staff. Starting at the department level, users can navigate into the inventory item categories and subcategories, all the way down to an individual inventory item.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
The screen displays all inventory departments
User clicks a department  cell
The screen displays all inventory categories for the selected department
User clicks a category cell that contains sub-categories
The screen displays all inventory sub-categories for the selected category
User clicks a sub-category cell (leaf category)
For a Unique Item category:
The screen displays a list of all inventory items for that selected category.
User clicks an item in the items list.
The screen displays the details for the item
For a Stock Item category:
The screen displays the details for th at Stock Item category
For a Under $5 category:
Nothing happens â€“ The category cell is not clickable.
Alt. Flow: At any point, the user may click on a department on the inventory department shortcuts list, which takes the user to the inventory view for that particular department.
The user may click the View All Items button at any level in the inventory to view a list of all items in that department or category
The user may click the View All Items button on the main inventory screen to view the complete list of all items in the inventory
Once in the view items list screen, th e user may filter the results by searching for:
A particular item by item number
All items with Donor, Department, Category or Description matching the provided keyword
All items with certain attributes, features and/or details
Postcondition: None

Name: Manage Departments and Add Department
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the inventory structure by defining the invent ory departments (not to be con fused actual retail floor departments known later in this document as stocking locations).
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
System displays the Add Department button
User clicks the Add Department button
User enters the Department data
System validates the Department data
System adds the new Department to the inventory
User is taken back to the main inventory screen
Alt. Flow: User cancels the Department add and is taken back to the main inventory screen
During data validation, data is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: The new Depar tment is added

Name: Manage Departments and Edit Department
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the inventory structure by defining the invent ory departments (not to be con fused actual retail floor departments known later in this document as stocking locations).
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User navigates to a Department  (see View Inventory)
System displays the Edit Department button
User clicks the Edit Department button
System displays the Department data
User edits Department data
System validates the Department data
System updates the Department information
User is taken back to the Department screen
Alt. Flow: User cancels the Department edit and is taken back to the main inventory screen
During data validation, data is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: The Department is updated

Name: Manage Departments and Delete Department
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the inventory structure by defining the invent ory departments (not to be con fused actual retail floor departments known later in this document as stocking locations).
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User navigates to a Department (see View Inventory)
System displays the Edit Department button
User clicks the Edit Department button
System displays the Department data
User clicks the Delete Department button
System validates the Department deletion
System removes  the Depart ment  from the inventory
User is taken back to the main inventory screen
Alt. Flow: User cancels the Department deletion and is taken back to the Department screen
During deletion validation, deletion is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: The Department is deleted

Name: Manage Categories and Add Category
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the inventory structure by defining the inventory departments and categories.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User navigates to a Department or Category (see View Inventory )
System displays the Add Category buttons:
Unique Item;
Stock Item.
User clicks the desired Add Category button
System displays the appropriate screen for the Category type:
Unique Item;
Stock Item.
User enters Category data
System validates the Category data
System adds the new Category to the inventory
User is taken back to the parent Department or Category of the added Category
Alt. Flow: User cancels the Category add and is taken back to parent Department or Category
During data validation, data is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: The new Cate gory is added

Name: Manage Categories and Edit Category
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the inventory structure by defining the inventory departments and categories.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User navigates to a Category (see View Inventory )
System displays the Edit Category button
User clicks the Edit Category button
System displays the appropriate screen for the Category type:
Unique Item;
Stock Item
User edits Category data
System validates the Category data
System updates the Category information
User is taken back to the Category screen
Alt. Flow: User cancels the Category edit and is taken back to Category screen
During data validation, data is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: The Category is updated

Name: Manage Categories and Delete Category
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the inventory structure by defining the inventory departments and categories.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User navigates to a Category (see View Inventory)
System displays the Edit Category button
User clicks the Edit Category button
System displays the appropriate screen for the Category type:
Unique Item;
Stock Item
User clicks the Delete Category button
System validates the Category deletion
System removes the Category from the inventory
User is taken back to the parent Department or Category of the deleted Category
Alt. Flow: User cancels the Category deletion and is taken back to the Category screen
During deletion validation, deletion is dee med invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: The Category is deleted

Name: Manage Categories and Move Categories
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the inventory structure by defining the inventory departments and categories.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User navigates to a Department or Category (see View Inventory)
System displays the Move Categories button
User clicks the Move Categories button
System displays the Move Categories screen
User selects Categories to move
User selects target location on categorized inventory for the moved Categories
User may select an existing Department or Category
User may choose to create a new Category to hold the moved Categories.
In this case, user selects the parent Department or Category of the new Category to be created
User enters the new Category data
User selects the type of move to be performed
Move selected categories as -is and make them children of the target Department or Category
Merge the contents (items) of the selected categories and add them to the target Department or Category
System validates the entered data
System moves the selected Categories
User is taken back to the parent Department or Category of the moved Categories
Alt. Flow: User cancels the Category move and is taken back to the parent Department or Category screen
During move validation, move is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: If the 'move to a new Category' option is selected, a new Category is created
If the 'move categories and make them children' option is selected, the selected Categories are moved to the selected target location
If the 'merge contents of selected categories' option is selected, the contents of the selected Categories are moved to the selected target location

Name: Manage Attributes and Details and View Item Attributes
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the attributes and det ails available for each inventory item. Attributes can be defined for each department, and details can be defined for each department and/or category.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
System displays the Edit Attributes button
User clicks the Edit Attributes button
System displays the Edit Attributes screen which displays all existing item attributes and their attribute x department assignments
Optionally, user filters view by attribute status (active, inactive, all)
User clicks the Done button
User is taken back to the main inventory screen
Alt. Flow: None
Postcondition: None

Name: Manage Attributes and Details and View Item Details
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the attributes and det ails available for each inventory item. Attributes can be defined for each department, and details can be defined for each department and/or category.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
System displays the Edit Details button
User clicks the Edit Details button
System displays the Edit Details screen which displays all existing item details and their detail x department and category assignments
Optionally, user filters view by detail status (active, inactive, all)
User clicks the Done button
User is taken back to the main inventory screen
Alt. Flow: None
Postcondition: None

Name: Manage Attributes and Details and Edit Item Attributes
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the attributes and det ails available for each inventory item. Attributes can be defined for each department, and details can be defined for each department and/or category.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
System displays the Edit Attributes button
User clicks the Edit Attributes button
System displays the Edit Attributes screen which displays all existing item attributes and their attribute x department assignments
Optionally, user filters view by attribute status (active, inactive, all)
User edits attributes
User changes attribute x department assignments
User changes attribute data
User changes attribute active x inactive status
User creates new attribute
System validates the attribute data
System updates the Item Attribute information
User clicks the Done button
User is taken back to the main inventory screen
Alt. Flow: User cancels the Item Attribute edit and is taken back to the main inventory screen
During data validation, data is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: The Item Attributes are updated

Name: Manage Attributes and Details and Edit Item Details
Brief Description: The system should allow inventory administrators to customize the attributes and det ails available for each inventory item. Attributes can be defined for each department, and details can be defined for each department and/or category.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
System displays the Edit Details button
User clicks the Edit Details button
System displays the Edit Details screen which displays al l existing item details and their detail x department and category assignments
Optionally, user filters view by detail status (active, inactive, all)
User edits details
User changes detail x department or category assignments
User changes detail data
User changes detail active x inactive status
User creates new detail
System validates the detail data
System updates the Item detail information
User clicks the Done button
User is taken back to the main inventory screen
Alt. Flow: User cancels the Item Detail edit and is taken back to the main inventory screen
During data validation, data is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: The Item Details are updated

Name: Add Item to Inventory
Brief Description: Items are typically added to the inventory as part of the donation processes. This is called adding an item in donation processing. Alternatively, items can be added during routine inventory maintenance. This is called adding an item in inventory management mode.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
The screen displays all inventory departments in matrix format  (see View Inventory)
User drills down to the appropriate category for the i tem
If in donation processing mode, the item entry screen is presented automatically
If in inventory management mode, the list of existing inventory items in that category is displayed
User clicks the Add Item button
The appropriate item entry screen is presented
User fills in item information
User confirms the addition of the new item
Inventory is updated
System gives the option of printing an item tag
User prints item tag(s)s for unique or stock item(s)
User attaches tag(s) to the item (s)
Alt. Flow: At any point, the user may click on a department on the inventory department shortcuts list, which takes the user to the inventory view for that particular department.
At any point while in the item add screen , the user may cancel the operation.
Postcondition: Item is present in the Inventory  Management System
Unique and stock items have item tags
In the case of a unique item, item is added to QuickBooks POS
In the case of a stock item, item quantity is updated in QuickBooks POS

Name: Manage Inventory Items and Modify Inventory Item
Brief Description: The system should allow various management actions to be performed on items existing in the inventory. These include modifying, deleting and splitting an item, and viewing the item's details and item history. These actions are only available for Unique and Stock items.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
The screen displays all inventory departments in matrix format with option to select and/or edit items to move them to a new department/category
User drills down to the desired existing inventory item (see View Inventory)
The item detail screen is presented
User modifies item information
The system validates item information
Item information is updated in the inventory
System gives the option of re-printing then item tag
User optionally re-prints the item tag and  attaches it to the item
Alt. Flow: User cancels the operation and is taken back to the item selection screen
During data validation, data is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: Item is updated in the inventory
Item is updated in QuickBooks POS

Name: Manage Inventory Items and Adjust Item Quantity
Brief Description: The system should allow various management actions to be performed on items existing in the inventory. These include modifying, deleting and splitting an item, and viewing the item's details and item history. These actions are only available for Unique and Stock items.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
The screen displays all inventory departments in matrix format
User drills down to the desired existing inventory item (see View Inve ntory)
The item detail screen is presented
User changes the item quantity
The system displays a confirmation screen where a  reason for the adjustment must  be specified by the user
The system validates the item change
Item information is updated in the inventory
Alt. Flow: User cancels the operation and is taken back to the item selection screen
During data validation, data is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: Item is updated in the inventory
Item is updated in QuickBooks POS

Name: Manage Inventory Items and Split Inventory Item
Brief Description: The system should allow various management actions to be performed on items existing in the inventory. These include modifying, deleting and splitting an item, and viewing the item's details and item history. These actions are only available for Unique and Stock items.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
The screen displays all inventory departments in matrix format
User drills down to the desired existing inventory item (see View Inventory)
The item d etail screen is presented
User clicks the Split Item button
The system displays the Item Split screen
User builds  the list of items that the original item will be split into
User can clone the original item to add new item(s) to the list that have similar attributes as the original item
User can add new items to the list by selecting Unique and Stock categories in the same way as adding a new item to the inventory (see Add Item to Inventory)
Once the list is complete, user confirms the split
The system validates the split
Item information is updated in the inventory
The original (split) item is updated in the inventory
Any new items that were added to the split list are added to the inventory maintaining parental history
Alt. Flow: User cancels the operation and is taken back to the item selection screen
During data validation, data is deemed invalid and an error message is presented to the user
Postcondition: Original item is updated in the inventory
Original item is updated in QuickBooks POS
New items are updated in the inventory
New items are updated in QuickBooks POS

Name: Manage Inventory Items and View Inventory Item History
Brief Description: The system should allow various management actions to be performed on items existing in the inventory. These include modifying, deleting and splitting an item, and viewing the item's details and item history. These actions are only available for Unique and Stock items.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the main inventory screen
The screen displays all inventory departments in matrix format
User drills down to the desired existing inventory item (see View Inventory)
The item det ail screen is presented
User clicks the Item History button
The system displays the Item History screen containing current and historical information about the inventory item
Alt. Flow: None
Postcondition: None

Name: Suggest Item Price
Brief Description: The system should assist in the task of pricing a new inventory item by making pricing suggestions to the user when adding to or modifying an item in the inventory. The suggested price s should be calculated based on the original and sale prices of similar items that currently exist or existed in the inventory in the past.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the inventory entry screen (see Add Item to Inventory , Manage Inventory Items )
System shows  price recommendations based on current item data and default price suggestion configuration options
User modifies item data
System makes new price suggestions based on new item data
Alt. Flow: User changes price suggestion configuration options
System shows new price recommendations based on current it em data and new configuration options
Postcondition: Price suggestion information is displayed on the screen

Name: View Acquisitions
Brief Description: Acquisition records for Drop-Off, Pickup and Decon donations are created in the CRM system. Inventory Management users should be able to view all past and current acquisitions . Receiving Associates use this function to locate an expected acquisition when receiving a donation at the loading dock. Pickup and Decon crews may also use this function to initiate the process of receiving items while in the truck, on their way to the receiving dock.  Drop Off acquisitions are not typically pre-scheduled as Pick Up and Decon acquisitions except for those submitted through the organizational website. As such, when a donor arrives with an unexpected drop off donation, a new acquisition needs to be able to be created in the CRM system first, at either the customer service desk or at the dock, before it can be viewed in the acquisitions screen.
Precondition: User is logged into the system
Basic Flow: User accesses the acquisitions screen
The screen displays a list of all acquisitions , latest ones at the top of the list
User may optionally filter the acquisitions displayed on the screen by changing filtering options
User clicks on an acquisition record
System display the details for that acquisition, including expected items
Alt. Flow: Drop Off acquisitions
User may alternatively click the New Drop Off button on the acquisition list screen which redirects the user to the CRM acquisition creation screen
User creates new Drop Off acquisition in the CRM system
User returns to the acquisitions screen and sees the newly created Drop Off acquisition
User can use a bar code scanner to scan the acquisition ticket generated at customer service
Postcondition: None

Name: Receive Acquisition
Brief Description: A donor in possession of a valid acquisition number can proceed to the receiving dock where the items to be donated will be received and processed, and a donation receipt will be generated. Alternatively, a donor may go directly to the receiving dock, in which case a new acquisition is created by the Receiving Associate before items can be received and processed. The screens used for the acquisition process should simplify and expedite the data entry process, allowing the Receiving Associate to enter only the information needed to generate the donation receipt. Additional attributes needed to complete the item information and effectively add the item to the inventory can be added at a second step, after the receipt has been printed and the donor has been served. The Receiving Associate can print temporary acquisition labels for items that require further processing.  Pick Up and Decon crews may also initiate the receiving process, entering as much detailed information about the donated items as desired, and generating a donation receipt. They cannot, however, add items to the inventory or complete the acquisition process. A Receiving Associate is required to review all the acquisition information before those actions can take place.
Precondition: An acquisition has been created for this donation in CRM and exists in the system in the Expected state.
Basic Flow: Donor or Primary Contact arrives at receiving dock with a valid donation number
Receiving Associate locates donation request in the system (see View Acquisitions)
System displays donation request information
Receiving Associate enters information about each donated item into the donation request  (see Add Item to Inventory )
A new item can be added to the list by cloning an existing item
A new item can be added by clicking the Add Item button
An item can be removed by setting the received quantity to zero
Receiving Associate  prints a donation receipt
Receiving Associate optionally writes information to the receipt by hand such as condition
Donation receipt is given to the Donor or Primary Contact
Receiving Associate prints item tags for unique and stock items (see Add It em to Inventory)
Receiving Associate attaches printed tags to corresponding items
Receiving Associate closes donation request
Alt. Flow: Items can be set aside for further processing
In this case, the Receiving Associate can alternatively tags displaying the donation number and donor information.
The acquisition is left in the Partially Received state until processing is completed at a later time
Postcondition: Donated items are present in the Inventory Management System
Unique and stock items have item tags
Unique items are added to POS
Quantities for stock items are updated in POS
Donor has dona tion receipt
Donation request in the system has a status of Processed

Name: Sell Item
Brief Description: Any item in the inventory may be purchased by a Construction Junction customer. The sale of the item is processed by QuickBooks POS and the inventory must be updated accordingly.
Precondition: The item being purchased has been previously added to the inventory.
Basic Flow: Buyer arrives at the cashier or checkout desk with the items to be purchased
Sales associate scans the item tags
Sales associate processes the sale of the items in QuickBooks POS
The system updates the inventory to reflect the sale
Alt. Flow: Certain items sold in QuickBooks POS may not exist in the inventory (under $5 items, for instance).
The system must be able to recognize that situation and bypass the inventory update.
Postcondition: Inventory is updated to reflect the sale
